findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: RCS - Redundant Conditional Statement
findings.description: The contract includes a redundant condition `_newMaxTxLimitPercent < 50` within the `setTxLimit` function, which always evaluates to true due to the constant variable `initialMaxTxLimitPercent` set to 1.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: PAV - Pair Address Validation
findings.description: The `setUniswapPair` function allows the contract owner to set the `uniswapPairAddress` to any arbitrary value without validation. This lack of validation can lead to unintended behavior, including the potential disruption of the contract's intended functionality.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. Declaring these variables as immutable can save gas by allowing the Solidity compiler to make certain optimizations.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not conform to the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.
